metadata.title: CVE-2023-43643 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: AntiSamy is a library for performing fast, configurable cleansing of HTMLcoming from untrusted sources. Prior to version 1.7.4, there is a potentialfor a mutation XSS (mXSS) vulnerability in AntiSamy caused by flawedparsing of the HTML being sanitized. To be subject to this vulnerabilitythe `preserveComments` directive must be enabled in your policy file andalso allow for certain tags at the same time. As a result, certain craftyinputs can result in elements in comment tags being interpreted asexecutable when using AntiSamy's sanitized output. This issue has beenpatched in AntiSamy 1.7.4 and later.

criterions.comment: libowasp-antisamy-java: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
